opendial

Class DialogueSystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • opendial.DialogueSystem

  • public class DialogueSystem
extends java.lang.Object

    Dialogue system based on probabilistic rules. A dialogue system comprises:

    • the current dialogue state
    • the dialogue domain with a list of rule-structured models
    • the list of system modules
    • the system settings.

    After initialising the dialogue system, the system should be started with the method startSystem(). The system can be paused or resumed at any time.

    Version:
    $Date:: 2014-01-31 01:24:04 #$
    Author:
    Pierre Lison (plison@ifi.uio.no)

      • detachModule

        public void detachModule(java.lang.Class<? extends Module> moduleClass)

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Starts the dialogue system. The content of the args array is ignored. Command-line parameters can however be specified through system properties via the -D flag. All parameters are optional.

        Possible properties are:

        • -Ddomain=path/to/domain/file: dialogue domain file
        • -Dsettings=path/to/settings/file: settings file
        • -Ddialogue=path/to/recorded/dialogue: dialogue file to import
        • -Dsimulator=path/to/simulator/domain/file: dialogue domain file for the simulator
        Parameters:
        args - is ignored.
